intro: Synima cordierorum, commonly known as the Cordier's synima, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
